title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.7.6 | 08-12-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम अज्ञान तिमिरान धस्या ज्ञानान जनिशलाकया
चक्षुरुन मीलितं जेनातस्मै श्री गुरवे नमहा
नमा ओम विश्णु पादाया कृष्ण प्रिष्ठाय भूतले
श्री मते भक्ति वेदांत स्वामिन तिनामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गौरवाणी प्रचारिने
मिर्विशेशा शुन्यवादी पाश्चात्य देशतारिने
जय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभू नित्यानन्दा
श्री अद्वैत गदाधर श्री वासादी गौरवक्त वृन्दा
हरे कृष्णा हरे कृष्णा कृष्ण कृष्णा हरे हरे हरे राम हरे रामा रामा रामा हरे हरे
ओम नमो भगवते वासु देवाया नारायणम नमस्कृत्य नरम चैवनरोत्तमम देवीम सरस्वतीम व्यासम ततो जयमुदी रयेट
in this session we will be discussing from the 6th verse of the 7th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam
अनर्थो पशमं साक्षाद भक्ति योगं अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अजानतो विद्वाम्स चक्रे सात्वत सम्हिताम
अनर्थो पशमं साक्षाद भक्ति योगं अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे
अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे
अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे
अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे
थे, इस वर्क में हम impactful 的 बार जो कहते है कि, स्थित पत्र वर्क में, वैकुल पर पत्र विशेष निर्मण हो रही या बीम करती है Monte है
वर्क में अपने वेसिड युद की वर्क है कि वो अक्सर वर्क हाथवटि में स्कूल है. यह
it is complete and perfect in all respects
so when it is described that Vyasadeva saw the personality of Godhead
it is qualified he saw the all perfect personality of Godhead
now Srila Prabhupada further explains what does it mean
this statement suggests that the complete unit of the personality of Godhead
includes his parts and parcels also
the Lord is always complete and he is never without his parts and parcels
he saw therefore what all did he see
he saw therefore his different energies
namely the internal energy, the marginal energy and the external energy
the Lord is always with his energies
so Vyasadeva when he saw the Lord
he saw his different energies also
he also saw his different plenary portions
and parts of the plenary portions
namely his different incarnations also
even though the Supreme Lord is one
one and only Supreme Personality of Godhead
but he is not a limited person
he has many different forms of incarnations
plenary portions
parts of plenary portions
and Vyasadeva also specifically observed
the unwanted miseries of the conditioned souls
who are bewildered by the external energy
this was explained in the previous verse
and here the remedial measure is given
and at last he saw the Lord
and here the remedial measure is given
and at last he saw the Lord
and at last he saw the Lord
and at last he saw the Lord
and at last he saw the remedial measure for the conditioned souls
namely the process of devotional service
this is the perfect remedy for the suffering of the conditioned souls
what is it?
it is the process of devotional service
this devotional service is a great transcendental science
and begins with the process of hearing and chanting
and begins with the process of hearing and chanting
the name, fame, glory, etc. of the Supreme Personality of Godhead
shravanam, kirtanam, vishnom
this is the beginning of the process of devotional service
revival of the dormant affection
or love of Godhead
does not depend on the mechanical system of hearing and chanting
generally people when they do something repeatedly
the process tends to become mechanical
just like routinely we do so many things very mechanically
but the process of devotional service is never a mechanical process
because it is the full involvement of the mind
because it is the full involvement of the mind
the full involvement of the spirit soul
of the spiritual personality
100% involved in this process
then only the process is effective
to the extent of achieving perfection
even if somebody does devotional service in a mechanical way
there is benefit
there is a benefit
but it is not sufficient to take us to perfection
so Shrila Prabhupada says
this transcendental process
it solely and wholly depends on the causeless mercy of the Lord
bhakti is something that is bestowed by the Supreme Lord
when the Lord is fully satisfied with the sincere efforts of the devotee
he may endow him with his loving transcendental service
so the complete perfection comes after
the devotee has rendered devotional service
with all his efforts sincerely
trying to please the Lord
and when the Lord is pleased
he bestows the perfection of love of God
but even with the prescribed forms of hearing and chanting
that is just one has begun
there is at once mitigation of the superfluous and unwanted miseries of material existence
the effect on the heart of the chanting and hearing
is immediately felt even by the beginner
before he is able to even make advancement
immediately
what is the immediate effect
the mitigation of material miseries
this is very important to understand
and it is a very great encouragement
for anyone
that immediately they begin to feel
the benefit of this process
such mitigation of material affection does not wait
for development of transcendental knowledge
this is what the impersonalists think
that unless there is knowledge
there is no progress in spiritual life
that is for the jnana process
bhakti process does not depend on development of transcendental knowledge
so the prabhupada says
rather knowledge is dependent on
devotional service
for the ultimate realization
of the supreme truth
so knowledge is dependent on devotion
but devotion is independent of knowledge
devotion helps us to awaken knowledge within our heart
so the process of devotional service
it directly acts on the contaminated consciousness to purify
but the devotee has to sincerely engage in the process
and patiently engage in the process
and patiently wait for complete purification
the complete purification takes some time
because we have been associating
with this material world
for a very very very long time
millions of lifetimes
and we have accumulated so much of this material contamination
life after life after life after life after life
in ignorance we have been simply engaging
in sense gratification
so that has to be cleansed away
before we can actually experience
the transcendental love
in reciprocation with the supreme lord
before that we have to cleanse the heart
these material miseries are described as superfluous
superfluous means
they are actually
not giving any benefit for us
they are simply useless stuff
that's why they are called
un-earth
in fact un-earth means unwanted
something which is unwanted
un-earth this body itself
material body itself is un-earth
it itself is un-earth
but in the material conception
we think we cannot exist
without the body
why because the body is the means
for our sense gratification
for our material enjoyment
that material enjoyment yes
we can have to whatever extent
we can get some material pleasure
by the means of the body
but as spirit soul
we are not meant to enjoy materially
neither material pleasures
give any satisfaction for the soul
the bhagavatam raises this point
what ensures that there is complete satisfaction for the soul
the satisfaction of the soul
of the real self
that is to be considered
the satisfaction of the soul is never possible
by any material pleasure
material means
material methods
material pleasures
material arrangements
it never even touches the soul
in any way
so therefore people
who are seeking real happiness
they are frustrated
when they make different arrangements
for enjoying materially
or they seek material happiness
and they never are satisfied
within their heart
never are satisfied
so this point is explained
in the bhagavad gita
yehi samsparishya ja bhoga
dukha yonaya evate
aadyantavan takaunteya
nateshu ramate budhah
one more verse that explains
what is the nature of transcendental happiness
sukham aatyantikam yatta buddhikrahyam atindriyam
you see this transcendental happiness
is an experience of
boundless transcendental joy
which is experienced with transcendental senses
atindriyam
not with this material senses
these material senses
are useless
for experiencing any
any spiritual happiness
or transcendental happiness
so material pleasure
is simply a sensation
and it is a
temporary thing
it is also called
chapala sukha
momentary happiness
and it eventually leads to
miseries only
whereas transcendental happiness
completely
pure bliss
and it is never
momentary
so i will stop here
thank you very much
harikrishnan
